sect3.title: Overview

figure.title: Example for the Line Nova filter

sect3.para: Line Nova command is a script which fills a layer with rays emanating outward from its center using the foreground color shown in the Toolbox. All lines radiates from the near center of the layer, and get broader to join both neighboring lines into outer solid field filled with the foreground color. Rendered lines are cropped on the every edge of the image to be fit inside of it.

tip.para: This filter does not provide any option which allow you to set the center point of lines. If you need adjust the place of the radial lines where you want, create another transparent image and apply this filter on it, then add it on your image. Setting large size for the new nova image may help you not to break lines inside of your image.

sect3.title: Activating the filter
sect3.para:
This filter is found in the image window menu under
Filters Render Line Nova .

listitem.para: By using this slider you can set the number of lines between 40 to 1000. The default is 200.

Every transparent chink between lines is tapering off toward the outer direction. To see the base image more wider, set this degree more shorter so that the chick spaces stretch longer. Allowed range is between 0.0 and 10.0, but note that 0.0 makes nothing drawn. The default is 1.0.

Almost lines don't reach the center point if this value is set over 0. By this option, you can set radius (between 0 to 2000 pixels) of the transparent space around the center point. The default value is 100 pixels.
Set this value more larger (up to 2000) to get more distoted radiation. Regular star shape is given by setting this value to 1. The default is 30.
